Linguistic analysis: The expert may have employed linguistic analysis techniques to examine the language used in the claim and compare it to known patterns or characteristics associated with authentic claims. This analysis could involve studying grammar, syntax, vocabulary, and other linguistic elements.
Fact: checking: The expert may have conducted extensive fact-checking to verify the accuracy of the claim. This could involve researching the backgrounds and actions of the mentioned senators (Ed Markey, Al Franken, and Jeanne Shaheen) to determine if there is any evidence or credible reports of them taking bribes from Iran or supporting an "insane NUKE deal."
Source evaluation: The expert may have evaluated the credibility and reliability of the sources that made the claim. This could involve assessing the reputation of the sources, checking for any potential biases or conflicts of interest, and cross-referencing the information with other trusted sources to establish its authenticity.
Corroboration: The expert may have sought corroboration from multiple independent sources or experts to validate the claim. This could involve reaching out to other individuals or organizations with relevant expertise or access to information that can confirm or refute the allegations made in the claim.
